intro: Prainea limpato var. longipedunculata, commonly known as the long-pedunculate prainea, is a species native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family, known for its ornamental value. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Its botanical characteristics make it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists.
